peregrine.io.memtable
Class ArenaRollingSequenceWriter

java.lang.Object
  peregrine.io.sstable.RollingSequenceWriter
      peregrine.io.memtable.DirectBufferRollingSequenceWriter
          peregrine.io.memtable.ArenaRollingSequenceWriter
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Closeable, java.io.Flushable, SequenceWriter
public class ArenaRollingSequenceWriter
extends DirectBufferRollingSequenceWriter

A RollingSequenceWriter that stores data in direct memory buffers where we use a DefaultChunkWriter and DefaultChunkReader to append to an in-memory index using 1MB slabs of direct memory. When that slab is exhausted we create a new slab. The keys are actually varints, the first varint is for the slab index and the second varint is for the offset within the slab. Since they are direct buffers I can send them directly out over the kernel via netty (though I should test to make sure this works via zero copy). In fact, the system we use whereby we allocate new chunks on rollover is VERY similar to DefaultPartitionWriter except instead of new files we create new slabs. Though DefaultPartitionWriter has more complexity than we really need but the general theory is the same.
